The key goal is to yield intact crypt samples suitable for culture and further dissociation into organoids. The protocols outline specific tools and reagents required for each step ensuring the isolation of crypt units with minimal contamination from other cell types. {"blocks":[{"key":"bf2rf","text":"Dissect intestine","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"79fv0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4pc00","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"99h1b","text":"1. Mount euthanized animal on dissection plate and secure in supine position with needles.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":1,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"faqfr","text":"2. Spray abdomen with 70% EtOH to wet and sterilize fur. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":1,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7s4sa","text":"3. Using large scissors and large forceps, make an incision into abdominal skin ~ 2 cm above the anus. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":1,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ae9p2","text":"4. Insert scissors below skin and open the blades to separate skin from muscle. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":1,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"95oju","text":"5. Cutting in a V-pattern, free the skin, lifting up and to the side to expose the abdominal muscle. Spray scissors with 70% EtOH to remove any fur that may be stuck on the blades. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":1,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cn60f","text":"6. Perform laparotomy to open abdominal cavity","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":1,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"490ff","text":"7. Using small scissors and forceps to shift visceral organs, locate the stomach underneath the liver. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":1,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fpges","text":"8. Holding the stomach with forceps at pyloric antrum, cut through the stomach immediately proximal to the forceps. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":1,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"aeg7","text":"9. Still holding the stomach, gently pull upward and to the left to remove intact intestine from duodenum to rectum.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":1,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":127,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"bhbrm","text":"IMPORTANT: While pulling, use small scissors or a second pair of forceps to release pancreatic adhesions and mesenteric plexus.   ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":1,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ehkuj","text":"10. Transfer to glass plate and stretch intestine to full length.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4ql3q","text":"2.           Duodenum: 1st 2-5 cm distal to pyloric sphincter","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"456i4","text":"3.           Jejunum: Middle third of the intestine ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2bp9u","text":"4.           (NOTE: Most small intestinal preps are made from jejunum)","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"a2efq","text":"5.           Ileum: distal 8-10 cm intestine","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"74q31","text":"6.           Trim large intestine by cutting distal to cecum and 10 mm proximal to anus. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9aubu","text":"7.           (NOTE: avoid collecting rectum and anus by omitting the distal ~0.5 cm from\ncollection)","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"d0aef","text":"8.           Proximal colon: Cecum to end of wide curvature","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5vbte","text":"9.           Distal colon: end of curvature to ~0.5 cm proximal to the anus","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

Plate organoid fragments in hemispheric matrigel ‘domes’ in the center of each culture

For 96 well plate, use 8-10 µL Matrigel
*Note: Place pipette tip on the bottom of the middle of the well, lift slightly, then depress
to first stop to plate Matrigel in hemispheric droplet","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":254,"length":148}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4jqs4","text":"9.
